Package managers

Class SceneManager

java.lang.Object
managers.SceneManager
public class SceneManager
extends java.lang.Object
This is the GUI framework. This class manages and changes scenes dynamically, based on user actions.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    SceneManager​(CustomLayeredPane pane, UserManager userManager)
    Constructor setting up the scenes.

    Method for returning a scene, which has the requested sceneID stored.

  • Constructor Details

    • SceneManager

      public SceneManager​(CustomLayeredPane pane, UserManager userManager) throws java.io.IOException
      Constructor setting up the scenes. Adding each of them to the known list and initialising the drawing pane.
      Parameters:
      pane - The pane which it will use to draw elements
      userManager - Set the managers, which will handle the user actions
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

  • Method Details

      userManager -

    • getLoginManager

      public UserManager getLoginManager()

    • activateScene

      public void activateScene​(int sceneID)
      Method for activating a new scene. On trigger, remove all elements from the main pane. Run scene functions - onActivate = run scene code before activating - setDefaultValues = run scene code after elements have been transfered to pane - updateMenuBar = detect if logged in user is an admin, and change the menubar accordingly Than add new sprites and object to the pane from the scene. Finally update the frame (revalidate, repaint).
      Parameters:
      sceneID - which scene should be displayed

    • getScene

      public Scene getScene​(int sceneID)
      Method for returning a scene, which has the requested sceneID stored.
      Parameters:
      sceneID - Which scene should be returned.
      Returns:
      Scene Found scene or null.

    • updateScene

      public void updateScene()
      Method for updating the GUI
